intro: Gochnatia glomeriflora, commonly known as the clustered gochnatia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats and features narrow, linear leaves. Its inflorescence consists of dense clusters of small yellow flowers, which are surrounded by pale green bracts. Gochnatia glomeriflora is often found in sandy soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments.
